frame.name: Execution
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Executioner</fen> punishes an individual (<fen>Executed</fen>) with death as a consequence of some action of the Evaluee (the <fen>Reason</fen>).
<ex><fex name="Executioner">The hooded man</fex> <t>hanged</t> <fex name="Executed">the thief</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Executioner
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Executioner</fen> is the individual who performs the execution.
<ex>The truth is, <fex name="Executioner">we</fex> have all <t>put</t> them <t>to</t> <t>death</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> with which an <fen>Executioner</fen> performs an execution.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The action that is taken that accomplishes the execution <ex><t>Execution</t> <fex name="Mns">by lethal injection</fex> is certainly humane.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which the execution is carried out. </def-root>

FE.name: Execution
FE.definition: <def-root>The punishment of death given to the <fen>Executed</fen> by the <fen>Executioner</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing a participant in the action.
<ex>He was <t>executed</t> <fex name="Depict">with only a loincloth on</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Executed
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Executed</fen> is the person who is killed by the <fen>Executioner</fen> in retribution for the crime that the <fen>Executed</fen> was convicted of.
<ex><fex name="Executed">He</fex> was to be <t>hanged</t> in the morning.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the execution event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). Moreover, it may indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Executioner</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>Often, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Explanation</t> for the Judge's judgment which the <fen>Executioner</fen> is carrying out. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP.
<ex>He was <t>hanged</t> <fex name="exp">for his crimes</fex>.</ex></def-root>
